straight.description: Whether to use Merge-Base: straight=false means using Merge-Base; straight=true means not using Merge-Base; default is false, meaning using Merge-Base

sourceType.description: Options: branch, tag; if it's a commit comparison, you can omit this; if it's a branch comparison, you need to provide: branch, or you can omit it but ensure there are no branch or tag name conflicts; if it's a tag comparison, you need to provide: tag; if there are branches and tags with the same name, you need to strictly provide branch or tag

targetType.description: Options: branch, tag; if it's a commit comparison, you can omit this; if it's a branch comparison, you need to provide: branch, or you can omit it but ensure there are no branch or tag name conflicts; if it's a tag comparison, you need to provide: tag; if there are branches and tags with the same name, you need to strictly provide branch or tag

to.description: Can be CommitSHA, branch name or tag name

organizationId.description: Organization ID

tools.name: get_project
tools.description: [Project Management] Get information about a Yunxiao project

adminUserId.description: Project administrator user ID, should use userId returned from getCurrentOrganizationInfoFunc or user-provided user ID, multiple IDs separated by commas

orderBy.description: Sort field, default is gmtCreate, supports: gmtCreate (creation time), name (name)

sort.description: Sort order, default is desc, options: desc (descending), asc (ascending)

createdAfter.description: Created not earlier than, format: YYYY-MM-DD

userId.description: User ID to use with scenarioFilter, should be the userId returned from getCurrentOrganizationInfoFunc

organizationId.description: Organization ID

perPage.description: Pagination parameter, page size, 0-200, default value is 20

extraConditions.description: Additional filter conditions as JSON string. Should be constructed similar to the conditions parameter. For common scenarios: 1) For 'projects I manage': use fieldIdentifier 'project.admin' with the user ID; 2) For 'projects I participate in': use fieldIdentifier 'users' with the user ID; 3) For 'projects I favorited': use fieldIdentifier 'collectMembers' with the user ID. Example: JSON.stringify({conditionGroups:[[{className:'user',fieldIdentifier:'project.admin',format:'multiList',operator:'CONTAINS',value:[userId]}]]})

scenarioFilter.description: Predefined filter scenarios: 'manage' (projects I manage), 'participate' (projects I participate in), 'favorite' (projects I favorited). Will be used to construct appropriate extraConditions. Requires userId from getCurrentOrganizationInfoFunc.

createdBefore.description: Created not later than, format: YYYY-MM-DD

status.description: Project status ID, multiple separated by commas

tools.name: search_projects
tools.description:
[Project Management] Search for Yunxiao Project List. A Project is a project management unit that includes work items and sprints, and it is different from a code repository (Repository).

Use Cases:

Query projects I am involved in
Query projects I have created

organizationId.description: Organization ID, can be found in the basic information page of the organization admin console

workItemId.description: Work item unique identifier, required parameter

tools.name: get_work_item
tools.description: [Project Management] Get information about a work item

organizationId.description: Organization ID

tools.name: create_work_item
tools.description: [Project Management] Create a work item

updatedAfter.description: Updated not earlier than, format: YYYY-MM-DD

creator.description: Creator user ID, multiple values separated by commas. Special value 'self' can be used to represent the current user

orderBy.description: Sort field, default is gmtCreate. Possible values: gmtCreate, subject, status, priority, assignedTo

createdAfter.description: Created not earlier than, format: YYYY-MM-DD

assignedTo.description: Assignee user ID, multiple values separated by commas. Special value 'self' can be used to represent the current user

organizationId.description: Organization ID

updatedBefore.description: Updated not later than, format: YYYY-MM-DD

createdBefore.description: Created not later than, format: YYYY-MM-DD

category.description: Search for work item types, such as Req (requirement), Task (task), Bug (defect), etc., multiple values separated by commas

includeDetails.description: Set to true when you need work item descriptions/detailed content. This automatically fetches missing descriptions instead of requiring separate get_work_item calls. RECOMMENDED: Use includeDetails=true when user asks for 'detailed content', 'descriptions', or 'full information' of work items. This is more efficient than calling get_work_item multiple times. Default is false

status.description: Status ID, multiple separated by commas. Status names and their IDs: Pending Confirmation (28), Pending Processing (100005), Reopened (30), Deferred Fix (34), Confirmed (32), Selected (625489), In Analysis (154395), Analysis Complete (165115), In Progress (100010), In Design (156603), Design Complete (307012), In Development (142838), Development Complete (100011), In Testing (100012)

category.description: Work item type category, optional values: Req, Bug, Task, etc.

organizationId.description: Organization ID, can be found in the basic information page of the organization admin console

organizationId.description: Organization ID, can be found in the basic information page of the organization admin console

createStartTime.description: Creation start time in milliseconds timestamp format (e.g., 1729178040000). For filtering pipelines created after this time.

perPage.description: Number of items per page, default 10, max 30

createEndTime.description: Creation end time in milliseconds timestamp format (e.g., 1729178040000). For filtering pipelines created before this time.

executeEndTime.description: Execution end time in milliseconds timestamp format (e.g., 1729178040000). For filtering pipelines executed before this time.

executeStartTime.description: Execution start time in milliseconds timestamp format (e.g., 1729178040000). For filtering pipelines executed after this time.

tools.name: list_pipelines
tools.description: [Pipeline Management] Get a list of pipelines in an organization with filtering options

pythonVersion.description: Python version for Python projects (LLM should read from .python-version or pyproject.toml). Options: 3.9, 3.12. Default: 3.12

dockerImage.description: Docker image name for container deployment

pauseStrategy.description: Pause strategy for VM deployment. firstBatchPause: The first batch is paused. noPause: No pause. eachBatchPause: Pause each batch. Default: firstBatchPause

jdkVersion.description: JDK version for Java projects (LLM should read from pom.xml or gradle.properties). Options: 1.6, 1.7, 1.8, 11, 17, 21. Default: 1.8

goVersion.description: Go version for Go projects (LLM should read from go.mod). Options: 1.19.x, 1.20.x, 1.21.x. Default: 1.21.x

kubectlVersion.description: Kubectl version for Kubernetes apply. Options: 1.25.16, 1.26.12, 1.27.9. Default: 1.27.9

branch.description: Git branch (LLM should get from 'git branch --show-current')

organizationId.description: Organization ID, can be found in the basic information page of the organization admin console

includePathInArtifact.description: Whether to include full path in artifact. Default: false

buildTool.description: Build tool (REQUIRED). LLM should infer from buildLanguage and project files: java+pom.xml‚Üímaven, java+build.gradle‚Üígradle, nodejs+package-lock.json‚Üínpm, nodejs+yarn.lock‚Üíyarn, python‚Üípip, go‚Üígo, dotnet‚Üídotnet

uploadType.description: Artifact upload type. flowPublic: Yunxiao public storage space, packages: Organization private generic package repository. Default: packages

mavenVersion.description: Maven version for Java projects. Options: 3.6.1, 3.6.3, 3.8.4, 3.9.3. Default: 3.6.3

kubernetesClusterId.description: Kubernetes cluster ID for K8s deployment (required when deployTarget=k8s)

batchNumber.description: Number of batches for VM deployment. Default: 2

repoUrl.description: Repository URL (LLM should get from 'git config --get remote.origin.url')

deployCommand.description: Custom deploy command for VM deployment

buildCommand.description: Custom build command to override default

artifactVersion.description: Artifact version number, required when uploadType is packages. Default: '1.0'

testCommand.description: Custom test command to override default

nodeVersion.description: Node.js version for Node projects (LLM should read from package.json engines.node or .nvmrc). Options: 16.8, 18.12, 20. Default: 18.12

buildLanguage.description: Programming language (REQUIRED). LLM should detect from project files: pom.xml‚Üíjava, package.json‚Üínodejs, requirements.txt‚Üípython, go.mod‚Üígo, *.csproj‚Üídotnet

serviceName.description: Service name (LLM can derive from repository name or project directory name)

yamlPath.description: Path to Kubernetes YAML file for K8s deployment

deployTarget.description: Deployment target from user description. vm: Virtual Machine/Host deployment, k8s: Kubernetes deployment, none: Build only without deployment. Default: none

machineGroupId.description: Machine group UUID for VM deployment (required when deployTarget=vm)

packagesRepoId.description: Packages generic repository ID, required when uploadType is packages. Default: 'flow_generic_repo'

packagesServiceConnection.description: Packages service connection UUID, required when uploadType is packages

serviceConnectionId.description: Service connection UUID for repository access

name.description: Pipeline name (required). LLM should generate a meaningful name based on user's request

artifactDownloadPath.description: Path to download artifacts on target machine for VM deployment. Default: /home/admin/app/package.tgz

executeUser.description: User for executing deployment scripts (root, admin). Default: root

tools.name: generate_pipeline_yaml
tools.description:
[Pipeline Management] Generate only the YAML configuration for a pipeline without creating it.

**üìã Use Cases:**
- Preview YAML before creating pipeline
- Generate YAML for manual deployment
- Debug pipeline configuration

**üìñ Recommended Workflow:**
1. üéØ Parse user description for explicit parameters
2. üîç If missing context, prefer IDE detection (terminal + file reading) over API calls
3. üöÄ Call this tool with collected parameters

**üí° Parameter Collection Strategy:**
- For QUICK pipeline creation: Use IDE detection (git config, file reading)
- For PRECISE parameter selection: Consider list_repositories, list_service_connections when needed
- Balance efficiency vs. accuracy based on user intent

**‚ö° Built-in capabilities:** Handles default service connections internally, auto-extracts project name from repo URL

uploadType.description: Artifact upload type. flowPublic: Yunxiao public storage space, packages: Organization private generic package repository. Default: packages

tools.name: create_pipeline_from_description
tools.description:
[Pipeline Management] Create a pipeline using structured parameters extracted from user descriptions and environment context.

**üîß Built-in Capabilities:**
- ‚úÖ Automatically retrieves default service connection IDs when not specified
- ‚úÖ Handles repository and service connection logic internally
- ‚úÖ Auto-extracts project name from repository URL (git@host:org/repo.git ‚Üí repo)
- ‚úÖ Supports both IDE detection and explicit parameter specification

**üìñ Flexible Workflow Options:**
1. üéØ PARSE user description for explicit parameters
2. üîç GATHER missing info using appropriate method:
   - QUICK: IDE detection (git config, file reading) - recommended for most cases
   - PRECISE: API calls (list_repositories, list_service_connections) when user needs specific selection
3. üöÄ CALL this tool with collected parameters

**üéØ Parameter Priority:**
1. üë§ USER EXPLICIT (highest) - buildLanguage, buildTool, versions, deployTarget
2. üîç CONTEXT DETECTION (flexible) - repoUrl, branch, serviceName, tech stack
3. ü§ñ TOOL DEFAULTS (automatic) - serviceConnectionId, organizationId

**üîç IDE Detection Rules (efficient for most cases):**
- üìÇ Repository: `git config --get remote.origin.url` ‚Üí repoUrl
- üåø Branch: `git branch --show-current` ‚Üí branch
- üè∑Ô∏è Service Name: Auto-extracted from repoUrl (git@host:org/repo.git ‚Üí repo)
- ‚òï Java Maven: pom.xml exists ‚Üí buildLanguage='java', buildTool='maven'
- üèóÔ∏è Java Gradle: build.gradle exists ‚Üí buildLanguage='java', buildTool='gradle'
- üü¢ Node npm: package.json + package-lock.json ‚Üí buildLanguage='nodejs', buildTool='npm'
- üß∂ Node yarn: package.json + yarn.lock ‚Üí buildLanguage='nodejs', buildTool='yarn'
- üêç Python: requirements.txt ‚Üí buildLanguage='python', buildTool='pip'
- üêπ Go: go.mod ‚Üí buildLanguage='go', buildTool='go'
- üíô .NET: *.csproj ‚Üí buildLanguage='dotnet', buildTool='dotnet'

**üìù Version Detection (from project files):**
- ‚òï JDK: Read pom.xml <maven.compiler.source> ‚Üí jdkVersion
- üü¢ Node: Read package.json engines.node ‚Üí nodeVersion
- üêç Python: Read .python-version, pyproject.toml ‚Üí pythonVersion
- üêπ Go: Read go.mod go directive ‚Üí goVersion

**üéØ Deployment Parsing:**
- 'ÈÉ®ÁΩ≤Âà∞‰∏ªÊú∫/VM/ËôöÊãüÊú∫' ‚Üí deployTarget='vm'
- 'ÈÉ®ÁΩ≤Âà∞Kubernetes/K8s' ‚Üí deployTarget='k8s'
- 'Âè™ÊûÑÂª∫/ÊûÑÂª∫Âà∂ÂìÅ' ‚Üí deployTarget='none'

**üîó Service Connection Strategy (3 scenarios):**
1. **User specifies ID explicitly** (e.g., '‰ΩøÁî®ÊúçÂä°ËøûÊé•ID abc123')
   ‚Üí ‚úÖ Pass serviceConnectionId=abc123 directly, NO list_service_connections call needed
2. **User doesn't specify any ID** (most common case)
   ‚Üí ‚úÖ Pass serviceConnectionId=null, tool will auto-retrieve default ID internally
3. **User wants to choose from available options** (e.g., 'ÊòæÁ§∫ÂèØÁî®ÁöÑÊúçÂä°ËøûÊé•ËÆ©ÊàëÈÄâÊã©')
   ‚Üí üîç Call list_service_connections first, then let user choose, then create pipeline

**ü§î When to Use Other Tools:**
- User asks to "select from available repositories" ‚Üí use list_repositories first
- User wants to "choose from service connections" ‚Üí use list_service_connections first
- User wants to see options before deciding ‚Üí gather info first, then create
- For quick creation with current repo ‚Üí directly use IDE detection

**‚úÖ Required:** organizationId, name, buildLanguage, buildTool

organizationId.description: Organization ID

timeReference.description: Natural language time reference such as 'today', 'yesterday', 'this week', 'last month', etc.

tools.name: smart_list_pipelines
tools.description: [Pipeline Management] Intelligently search pipelines with natural language time references (e.g., 'today', 'this week')

organizationId.description: Organization ID, can be found in the basic information page of the organization admin console

branchMode.description: Whether to run in branch mode

tag.description: Tag to use for this repository

branch.description: Branch to use for this repository

environmentVariables.description: Environment variables for the pipeline run

description.description: Natural language description of how to run the pipeline, e.g. 'Run pipeline using branch mode with branches main and develop'

params.description: Pipeline run parameters in JSON string format. Can include: branchModeBranchs(array), envs(object), runningBranchs(object), runningTags(object), runningPipelineArtifacts(object), runningAcrArtifacts(object), runningPackagesArtifacts(object), comment(string), needCreateBranch(boolean), releaseBranch(string)

branches.description: Branches to use in branch mode or specific branches for repositories

createReleaseBranch.description: Whether to create a release branch

tools.name: create_pipeline_run
tools.description: [Pipeline Management] Run a pipeline with optional parameters

organizationId.description: Organization ID, can be found in the basic information page of the organization admin console

pipelineId.description: Pipeline ID to get the latest run information

tools.name: get_latest_pipeline_run
tools.description: [Pipeline Management] Get information about the latest pipeline run

organizationId.description: Organization ID, can be found in the basic information page of the organization admin console

pipelineRunId.description: Pipeline run ID to retrieve details for

tools.name: get_pipeline_run
tools.description: [Pipeline Management] Get details of a specific pipeline run instance

organizationId.description: Organization ID, can be found in the basic information page of the organization admin console

perPage.description: Number of items per page, default 10, max 30

startTime.description: Execution start time filter in milliseconds timestamp format

endTime.description: Execution end time filter in milliseconds timestamp format

pipelineId.description: Pipeline ID to list runs for

status.description: Run status filter: FAIL, SUCCESS, or RUNNING

tools.name: list_pipeline_runs
tools.description: [Pipeline Management] Get a list of pipeline run instances with filtering options

organizationId.description: Organization ID, can be found in the basic information page of the organization admin console

category.description: Task category, currently only supports DEPLOY

tools.name: list_pipeline_jobs_by_category
tools.description: [Pipeline Management] Get pipeline execution tasks by category. Currently only supports DEPLOY category.

organizationId.description: Organization ID, can be found in the basic information page of the organization admin console

perPage.description: Number of items per page, default 10, max 30

category.description: Task category, currently only supports DEPLOY

tools.name: list_pipeline_job_historys
tools.description: [Pipeline Management] Get the execution history of a pipeline task. Retrieve all execution records for a specific task in a pipeline.

organizationId.description: Organization ID, can be found in the basic information page of the organization admin console

jobId.description: Job ID for the pipeline run task

tools.name: execute_pipeline_job_run
tools.description: [Pipeline Management] Manually run a pipeline task. Start a specific job in a pipeline run instance.

organizationId.description: Organization ID, can be found in the basic information page of the organization admin console

jobId.description: Job ID of the pipeline run task

tools.name: get_pipeline_job_run_log
tools.description: [Pipeline Management] Get the execution logs of a pipeline job. Retrieve the log content for a specific job in a pipeline run.

organizationId.description: Organization ID

perPage.description: Number of items per page, default value is 8

repoTypes.description: Repository types, available values: GENERIC/DOCKER/MAVEN/NPM/NUGET, multiple types can be separated by commas

repoCategories.description: Repository modes, available values: Hybrid/Local/Proxy/ProxyCache/Group, multiple modes can be separated by commas

tools.name: list_package_repositories
tools.description: [Packages Management] List package repositories in an organization with filtering options

organizationId.description: Organization ID

perPage.description: Number of items per page, default is 10

orderBy.description: Sort method: latestUpdate - by latest update time; gmtDownload - by latest download time

sort.description: Sort order: asc - ascending; desc - descending

tools.name: list_artifacts
tools.description: [Packages Management] List artifacts in a package repository with filtering options

organizationId.description: Organization ID

id.description: Artifact ID, can be obtained from ListArtifacts API

tools.name: get_artifact
tools.description: [Packages Management] Get information about a single artifact in a package repository

tools.name: list_service_connections
tools.description: [Service Connection Management] List service connections in an organization with filtering options
